item.title: 家乐福从 Cora 和 Match 的收购中看到了更多的上升空间
item.description: 欧洲最大的食品零售商家乐福周一表示，预计收购 Cora 和 Match 零售商将带来比以前更大的经济效益。【原文：Europe's biggest food retailer Carrefour said on Monday it was expecting greater financial benefits from the acquisition of the Cora and Match retailers than previously.】

item.title: 在线博彩公司 Flutter 邀请迪士尼资深员工加入董事会
item.description: 全球最大的在线博彩公司 Flutter Entertainment 周一表示，已任命华特迪士尼前财务总监克里斯蒂娜-麦卡锡（Christine McCarthy）为董事会成员。【原文：Flutter Entertainment , the world's largest online betting firm, said on Monday it has appointed Walt Disney's former finance chief Christine McCarthy to its board of directors.】

item.title: CDK Global的黑客攻击为何给美国汽车销售蒙上阴影？
item.description: CDK Global 公司周一表示，预计所有经销商将在 7 月 3 日晚些时候或 7 月 4 日凌晨启用其经销商管理系统（DMS）。【原文：CDK Global said on Monday it anticipates all dealers to be live on its dealer management system (DMS) by late July 3 or early morning on July 4, about two weeks after a cyberattack-led outage upended operations across car dealerships in the U.S.】

item.title: 消息人士称赛诺菲有意在德国投资高达 16 亿美元的胰岛素项目
item.description: 一位熟悉该计划的人士周一告诉路透社，法国制药商赛诺菲即将决定投资 13 亿至 15 亿欧元（14 亿至 16 亿美元）来升级其在德国的长效胰岛素注射剂生产。【原文：French drugmaker Sanofi is nearing a decision to invest between 1.3 billion and 1.5 billion euros ($1.4-$1.6 billion) to upgrade its production of long-acting insulin shots in Germany, a person familiar with the plan told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: CDK 预计所有经销商将于 7 月 4 日初上线
item.description: CDK 周一表示，预计所有经销商将在 7 月 3 日晚些时候或 7 月 4 日清晨启用其经销商管理系统（DMS）。【原文：CDK said on Monday it anticipates all dealers to be live on its dealer management system (DMS) by late July 3 or early morning on July 4.】

item.title: 法拉利推出电池更换计划，以保持其汽车的性能和价值
item.description: 豪华跑车制造商法拉利周一宣布了两项新的延长保修计划，允许其混合动力车型的车主在指定时间更换电池。【原文：Luxury sports car maker Ferrari on Monday announced two new warranty extension schemes allowing owners of its hybrid models to have the batteries of their vehicles replaced at given times.】

item.title: 消息人士称，法国反垄断监管机构正准备对英伟达提出指控
item.description: 直接知情人士透露，法国反垄断监管机构正准备对 Nvidia 涉嫌反竞争的行为提出指控，Nvidia 将成为第一个这样做的执法者。【原文：French antitrust regulators are preparing to charge Nvidia for allegedly anti-competitive practices, people with direct knowledge of the matter said, making it the first enforcer to do so.】

item.title: 贝莱德推出股票 ETF，100% 对冲下跌风险
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周一表示，该公司已推出一款 "缓冲 "交易所交易基金，旨在为那些希望进入股票市场的风险偏好型投资者提供 100% 的下行对冲。【原文：BlackRock has launched a 'buffer' exchange-traded fund that seeks to offer a 100% downside hedge to risk-shy investors looking to tap the equity markets, the world's largest asset manager said on Monday.】

item.title: 交易应用程序 Robinhood 表示正在努力解决服务中断问题
item.description: Robinhood 周一表示，该公司正在努力解决导致其交易平台部分用户服务中断的问题。【原文：Robinhood said on Monday it was working to resolve an issue causing service interruptions for some users on its trading platform.】

item.title: 美国 5 月建筑支出意外下降
item.description: 由于较高的抵押贷款利率抑制了独户住宅的建设，美国 5 月份的建筑支出意外下降，而住房供应的改善可能会抑制建筑业的复苏。【原文：U.S. construction spending unexpectedly fell in May as higher mortgage rates depressed single-family homebuilding, and recovery is likely to be muted by improving housing supply.】

item.title: 空中客车可能最终拥有 Spirit Aero 在苏格兰和马来西亚的部分资产
item.description: 空中客车公司周一提交的一份文件显示，如果这家跨大西洋供应商无法找到买家，空中客车公司最终可能会拥有精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）在苏格兰和马来西亚的部分资产。【原文：Airbus may end up owning some assets of Spirit AeroSystems in Scotland and Malaysia if the transatlantic supplier is unable to find a buyer for them, a filing from the aerostructures company showed on Monday.】

item.title: 贝莱德在 Preqin 交易后预告将推出私募市场指数
item.description: 贝莱德（BlackRock）资产管理公司周一表示，在宣布以近 32 亿美元收购数据提供商 Preqin 的交易后，该公司可能开始为私募市场提供指数和交易所交易基金（ETF）。【原文：BlackRock could start offering indexes and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) for private markets, the asset manager said on Monday, after it announced a deal to buy data provider Preqin for nearly $3.2 billion.】

item.title: 墨西哥新任农业部长表示，墨西哥将放弃削减黄玉米进口的计划
item.description: 即将上任的墨西哥农业部长表示，墨西哥即将上任的政府将放弃即将离任的总统安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）的核心目标，即减少黄玉米进口，实现谷物生产自给自足。【原文：Mexico's incoming government will discard a core goal of outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador to reduce imports of yellow corn and achieve self-sufficiency in production of the grain, according to the incoming agriculture minister.】

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯美联储仍有信心使通胀率回到 2
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）在周日发表的评论中表示，他仍然认为物价压力正在放缓，回到央行的目标水平。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said he continues to believe price pressures are moderating back to the levels targeted by the central bank, in comments made on Sunday.】

item.title: 美国制造业陷入疲软；支付价格指数创六个月新低
item.description: 6 月份，美国制造业连续第三个月萎缩，在商品需求疲软的情况下，衡量工厂支付的投入品价格降至六个月来的最低点，这表明通胀可能继续减弱。【原文：U.S. manufacturing contracted for a third straight month in June and a measure of prices paid by factories for inputs dropped to a six-month low amid weak demand for goods, indicating that inflation could continue to subside.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利选择毕马威会计师事务所对数字支付平台 PagoPA 进行估值
item.description: 意大利财政部已选择会计师事务所毕马威（KPMG）为处理公共行政部门数字支付的 PagoPA 公司标价，准备将该业务出售给国家造币厂和邮政服务公司意大利邮政（Poste Italiane）。【原文：Italy's Treasury has picked accounting firm KPMG to put a price tag on PagoPA, a company handling digital payments to the public administration, as it prepares to sell the business to the state mint and postal service Poste Italiane , people close to the matter said.】

item.title: 古巴在危机日益加剧之际宣布 "战时经济 "新措施
item.description: 古巴政府周日晚些时候表示，将加倍加强价格控制，并继续打击逃税行为，以求遏制财政赤字膨胀和通胀飙升对古巴经济造成的破坏。【原文：Cuba`s government said late on Sunday it would double down on price controls and continue to fight tax evasion in an increasingly desperate bid to tamp down on a ballooning fiscal deficit and spiraling inflation that have devastated its economy.】

item.title: 百时美施贵宝支付 270 万美元解决以色列反竞争指控
item.description: 以色列竞争管理局周一表示，百时美施贵宝公司已同意在以色列支付 1,000 万谢克尔（270 万美元），以解决其阻止仿制抗癌药 Imnovid 的潜在案件。【原文：Bristol Myers Squibb has agreed to pay 10 million shekels ($2.7 million) in Israel to settle a potential case over its blocking of a generic version for anti-cancer drug Imnovid, Israel's Competition Authority said on Monday.】

item.title: 激进投资者发起的竞选活动数量创历史新高，但赢得的董事会席位却越来越少
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays）的数据显示，在 2024 年的前六个月里，激进投资者在全球范围内发起活动的公司数量创下了历史新高，但由于公司进行了有效的反击，激进投资者打入董事会的成功率并不高。【原文：Activist investors mounted campaigns at a record number of companies globally during the first six months of 2024 but have been less successful in breaking into boardrooms as companies fought back effectively, data from Barclays shows.】

item.title: 对冲基金流向 高盛数据显示对冲基金错过法国大选后股票跳涨行情
item.description: 根据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）6月28日的一份报告，对冲基金押注银行股上涨，上周以2021年5月以来最快的速度放弃了交易，这意味着他们错过了周一法国大选第一轮投票后银行股的涨势。【原文：Hedge funds betting on a rise in banking shares abandoned trades last week at the fastest pace since May 2021, according to a June 28 Goldman Sachs note, meaning they missed the sector's rally on Monday after the first round in the French election.】

item.title: 焦点转向就业数据，期指寸步难行
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货在制造业采购经理人指数数据公布前走高，本周晚些时候的美国劳动力市场数据也将成为关注焦点，这些数据将为美联储的货币政策路径提供线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Monday ahead of manufacturing PMI data, with focus also on U.S. labor market numbers later in the week that will be parsed for cues on the Federal Reserve's monetary policy path.】

item.title: 以人工智能为重点的科技公司 6 月市值大幅跃升
item.description: 以人工智能为重点的公司（主要是芯片制造商）的市值在 6 月底出现大幅增长，其中英伟达（Nvidia）曾短暂超越微软，成为全球最有价值的公司。【原文：Artificial intelligence-focused companies, mostly chipmakers, saw big gains in their market capitalization at the end of June, with Nvidia briefly overtaking Microsoft to become the most valuable company in the world.】

item.title: 股票影响者 "Roaring Kitty "披露持有 Chewy 6.6% 的股份
item.description: 被称为 "Roaring Kitty "的股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）周一披露持有 Chewy 6.6% 的股份，使这家宠物产品零售商的股价在盘前交易中上涨了 16%。【原文：Keith Gill, the stock influencer known as "Roaring Kitty", on Monday disclosed a 6.6% stake in Chewy , sending shares of the pet products retailer 16% higher in premarket trading.】

item.title: 美国最高法院将对涉及借记卡 "刷卡费 "的案件作出裁决
item.description: 美国最高法院预计将于周一对一起涉及对美联储关于借记卡 "刷卡费 "规定的法律挑战的案件作出裁决，这一裁决可能会使企业更容易试图推翻长期存在的联邦规定。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court was expected on Monday to decide a case involving a legal challenge to a Federal Reserve regulation on debit card "swipe fees" in a ruling that could make it easier for businesses to try to overturn longstanding federal rules.】

item.title: 早间竞标下半年开始，市场押注法国僵局
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: Tiny Chain Bridge 是特朗普和共和党竞选活动的顶级银行家
item.description: 当共和党竞选团队需要一位银行家时，他们不会去纽约或旧金山，而是去弗吉尼亚州的麦克莱恩市中心--距离白宫大约 20 分钟车程，在那里，一家汽车修理店旁边只有一家分行的银行击败了更大的金融竞争对手，成为政治工作中必备的合作伙伴。【原文：When Republican campaigns want a banker, they don't go to New York or San Francisco, but to downtown McLean, Virginia - about a 20 minute drive from the White House, where a one-branch bank next to an auto repair shop has beaten bigger financial rivals to become a must-have partner for political work.】

item.title: 瑞银完成与瑞士信贷的瑞士业务合并
item.description: 瑞士联合银行（UBS）周一表示，该行已完成其国内业务部门与瑞士信贷（Credit Suisse）在其国内市场业务的合并，并补充说瑞士信贷的业务主管即将离开该行。【原文：Swiss bank UBS has completed the merger of its domestic unit with Credit Suisse's operations in its home market, the bank said on Monday, adding that the head of the Credit Suisse business was leaving the bank.】

item.title: 聚焦：亚马逊回避贝索斯参与资助的碳补偿标准
item.description: 亚马逊是第一家避开全球碳抵消核查标准的公司，该标准由一家非营利组织制定，主要由这家美国科技企业集团的创始人兼执行主席杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）资助。【原文：Amazon has become the first company to sidestep a global standard for verifying carbon offsets that was developed by a non-profit funded largely by the U.S. technology conglomerate's founder and executive chair, Jeff Bezos.】

item.title: 特斯拉交付量将连续第二个季度下降
item.description: 特斯拉 6 月份的交付量可能会下降 3.7%，这是这家顶级电动汽车制造商首次出现连续两个季度的下滑，因为它要应对中国市场的激烈竞争，以及由于缺乏经济实惠的新车型而导致的需求放缓。【原文：Tesla's June-quarter deliveries likely fell 3.7%, the first time the top EV maker is set to post two straight quarters of decline, as it deals with stiff competition in China and slow demand due to a lack of affordable new models.】

item.title: Meta 被控未遵守欧盟技术规则
item.description: Meta Platforms 周一受到欧盟反垄断监管机构的指控，称其未能遵守具有里程碑意义的技术规则，监管机构矛头直指其新推出的付费或同意广告模式。【原文：Meta Platforms was charged by EU antitrust regulators on Monday for failing to comply with landmark tech rules as they took aim at its newly introduced pay or consent advertising model.】
